cancelAuction(uint256).details: Only seller can cancel, only before first bid

params.assetHash: Hash of asset details (for off-chain assets)
params.bidIncrementBps: Minimum bid increment in basis points
params.nftContract: NFT contract address (only for NFTs, address(0) otherwise)
params.quantity: Quantity (for ERC1155, must be 1 for ERC721, 0 for off-chain)
params.standard: Token standard (ERC721 or ERC1155, only for NFTs)
params.tokenId: Token ID to auction (only for NFTs, 0 otherwise)

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[ERC section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

verifyAssetHash(uint256,string).details: Useful for buyers to verify asset authenticity before/after auction

params.assetDetails: String representation of asset details to verify

withdraw().details: Allows users to withdraw funds that couldn't be automatically refunded

auctions(uint256).notice: Mapping from auction ID to auction data

bidderAuctions(address,uint256).notice: Mapping bidder => array of auction IDs where they're highest bidder

createAuction(uint8,address,uint256,uint.notice: Create a new auction for any asset type

emergencyWithdraw(uint256).notice: Emergency withdrawal if auction ended but not settled

endAuction(uint256).notice: End auction and settle (transfer NFT, distribute payment)

pendingWithdrawals(address).notice: Mapping of pending withdrawal amounts for outbid users (pull-over-push pattern)

placeBid(uint256).notice: Place a bid on an auction

sellerAuctions(address,uint256).notice: Mapping seller => array of auction IDs

verifyAssetHash(uint256,string).notice: Verify off-chain asset details match stored hash
